identificationModule.briefTitle: Exercise Capacity Before and After AF Ablation in Patients With HFpEF
identificationModule.officialTitle: Exercise Capacity in Patients With Heart Failure With Preserved Ejection Fraction Before and After Ablation of Atrial Fibrillation

descriptionModule.briefSummary: In a prospective, observational pilot study of patients scheduled for an atrial fibrillation (AF) ablation at the University of Vermont Medical Center the investigators will compare exercise capacity before and four months after AF ablation.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Patients ≥ 18 years of age who are scheduled for an AF ablation at the University of Vermont Medical Center will be screened for the following inclusion criteria: H2FpEF score of ≥ 6 (corresponding to ≥90% probability of HFpEF (19)) AND echocardiogram within the past 2 years that reported a LV ejection fraction ≥ 50% AND at least one symptom of HF (dyspnea on exertion, orthopnea or paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea). Exclusion criteria: (1) Life expectancy \<12 months, (2) moderate or more valvular disease, (3) inability to walk on a treadmill. Patients with early recurrent AF (defined as AF after a 12-week post-procedural blanking period accounting for post-ablation inflammation) will be withdrawn from the study and not proceed to the 4 month follow up visit.

conditions: Heart Failure With Preserved Ejection Fraction

primaryOutcomes.description: cardiopulmonary exercise testing will be performed \& peak VO2 measured at baseline \& follow up visit
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: before AF ablation and 4 months after AF ablation

secondaryOutcomes.description: Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire (KCCQ) will be obtained at baseline visit \& again at ablation follow up visit. Scale 0-100 with higher scores signifying better quality of life.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: before and 4 months after AF ablation

secondaryOutcomes.description: Initial sample taken day of AF ablation as is standard of care; reassessed at 4 month f/u visit
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: before and 4 months after AF ablation

otherOutcomes.measure: Difference in peak VO2 in patient with vs. without chronic rate control
otherOutcomes.description: 4 months f/u cardiopulmonary exercise testing performance compared between those with and without chronic rate control

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* H2FpEF score of ≥ 6 (corresponding to \>90% probability of HFpEF (19))
* echocardiogram within the past 2 years that reported a LV ejection fraction ≥ 50%
* at least one symptom of HF (dyspnea on exertion, orthopnea or paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea).
* AF ablation scheduled at UVMMC

Exclusion Criteria:

* Life expectancy \<12 months
* moderate or more valvular disease
* inability to walk on a treadmill
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Adults with atrial fibrillation and HFpEF who are undergoing AF ablation
